# Corpus Source Documentation

Provenance and legal citations for all test corpus documents.

## Entries

| ID | Jurisdiction | Short Name | Legal Citation | Source |
|----|-------------|------------|----------------|--------|
| `eu-gdpr` | EU | GDPR | Regulation (EU) 2016/679 | Official Journal of the European Union, L 119, 4 May 2016 |
| `eu-eprivacy` | EU | ePrivacy Directive | Directive 2002/58/EC | Official Journal of the European Communities, L 201, 31 July 2002 |
| `us-ca-ccpa` | US-CA | CCPA | Cal. Civ. Code 1798.100 et seq. | California Civil Code, Title 1.81.5 |
| `us-va-vcdpa` | US-VA | VCDPA | Va. Code Ann. 59.1-575 et seq. | Code of Virginia, Title 59.1, Chapter 53 |
| `us-co-cpa` | US-CO | CPA | C.R.S. 6-1-1301 et seq. | Colorado Revised Statutes, Title 6, Article 1, Part 13 |
| `us-ct-ctdpa` | US-CT | CTDPA | Conn. Gen. Stat. 42-515 et seq. | Connecticut General Statutes, Title 42, Chapter 743dd |
| `us-ut-ucpa` | US-UT | UCPA | U.C.A. 13-61-101 et seq. | Utah Code Annotated, Title 13, Chapter 61 |
| `us-tx-tdpsa` | US-TX | TDPSA | Tex. Bus. & Com. Code 541.001 et seq. | Texas Business and Commerce Code, Title 11, Subtitle C |
| `us-ia-icdpa` | US-IA | ICDPA | Iowa Code 715D.1 et seq. | Iowa Code, Chapter 715D |
| `us-hipaa` | US-Federal | HIPAA | 42 USC 1320d | United States Code, Title 42, Chapter 7, Subchapter XI, Part C |
| `us-hipaa-cfr` | US-Federal | 45 CFR 164 | 45 CFR Part 164 | Code of Federal Regulations, Title 45, Part 164 |
| `gb-dpa2018` | GB | DPA 2018 | 2018 c. 12 | Acts of Parliament, 2018 c. 12 |
| `gb-si-example` | GB | GDPR SI 2019 | S.I. 2019/419 | Statutory Instruments, S.I. 2019 No. 419 |
| `intl-uncitral` | INTL | UNCITRAL Model Law | GA Res. 51/162 (1996) | United Nations Commission on International Trade Law, 1996 |
| `au-privacy` | AU | Privacy Act 1988 | Act No. 119 of 1988 | Commonwealth of Australia, Act No. 119 of 1988 |

## Notes

- All source documents are structural excerpts used for parser validation testing.
- Documents are representative of their respective legal traditions and formatting conventions.
- The corpus covers 5 format families: EU Regulation, EU Directive, US State/Federal, UK Primary/Secondary, and Generic/International.
- Source texts are simplified excerpts that preserve the structural patterns (chapters, articles, sections, definitions) characteristic of each jurisdiction.
